Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.examples.messaging

Class Initiator

java.lang.Object
it.unipr.sowide.actodes.actor.Behavior
it.unipr.sowide.actodes.examples.messaging.Initiator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public final class Initiator
extends Behavior
The Initiator class defines a behavior that checks if the application is based on either one or more actor spaces. If the application involves only the local actor space then it creates a set of Receiver actors and a Sender actor. Finally, it kills itself. If the application involves more than an actor space then it creates a set of Receiver actors in all the actor space and a Sender actor in the local actor space. Finally, it kills itself. Moreover, this class allows to a user to select the type of execution, the number to be sent, and the number of nodes of the distributed application. When the execution is distributed on a set of actors spaces, then the first must be an broker actor space, then there can be zero or more node actor space, and finally the last one must be the initiator actor space.
See Also:
Receiver, Sender, Serialized Form

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] v)
      Starts both the standalone and the distributed version of the messaging example.
      Parameters:
      v - the arguments. It does not need arguments. Note that this actor space must be started after all the other actor spaces of the application.
